All, whilst this is not really what Jason is looking for, it reminded me 
of one of my favorite flicks, and I am going to sit down to it right 
now, Sydney Polak's "the Yakuza" with Robert Mitchum and Takakura Ken. 
It may or may not be accurate, but I think it is a great flick.

Rich Turner

Barry Thomas wrote:

>
> G'day Jason,
> Welcome.  I know how much my life and sword interests broadened when I 
> found
> the first sword lists back in 1995.  This Samurai History list came much
> later.  But to your question re the Yakuza and their history.  I have only
> one book and it seems to cover them from Go to Whoa (well, still going!).
> They began to attract the attention of officials around 1612...  Well, go
> find a copy of the (paperback, 414 pages):
>
> YAKUZA
> The explosive account of Japan's criminal underworld
> Alex Dubro and David E Kaplan
> Futura (1986)
> ISBN 0 7088 3573 2
>
